summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the custody and security arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections in New Hampshire. It discusses adding her New York attorneys to her approved contact list and details strict security protocols, including isolation, constant monitoring, and restrictions on staff interaction.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the custody and security protocols at Merrimack DOC. She is a high-profile inmate with restricted communication privileges, authorized to speak only with her legal counsel.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, initially the only legal counsel authorized for contact with her in custody, as per the security directives.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved list of people she can speak with on the phone.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved list of people she can speak with on the phone.

connections.description: Vogelman is authorized as Maxwell's legal counsel for contact while she is in custody at Merrimack DOC.
Everdell is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys, and a request is made to add him to her approved contact list.
Cohen is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys, and a request is made to add him to her approved contact list.
Both are identified as New York attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell in the same request.

events.title: Implementation of Maxwell Custody Protocols
events.description: The Supervisory Deputy U.S. Marshal issues strict security directives for Ghislaine Maxwell's custody at Merrimack DOC, including housing in medical isolation, constant observation, and restricted communication.

events.title: Request to Add Attorneys to Contact List
events.description: An email exchange occurs requesting the addition of attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen to the list of people Ghislaine Maxwell is authorized to speak with by phone.

locations: Merrimack DOC (Merrimack County Department of Corrections, New Hampshire)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections in New Hampshire under extremely high-security protocols in July 2020.
Security directives included housing her in medical isolation (MI), posting SRT personnel, a 15-minute observation watch, and a ban on staff conversation with her outside of health and safety needs.
Initially, only attorney Lawrence Vogelman was authorized for legal contact with Maxwell, prompting a request to also add her New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
The document highlights the U.S. Marshals Service's control over her custody arrangements and the highly restricted nature of her detention due to the high-profile status of the case.
